question: "Bibliotheca Corviniana" was one of the most renowned libraries of the Renaissance world. Which country was the location of it?
explanation: Bibliotheca Corviniana was one of the most renowned libraries of the Renaissance world, established by Matthias Corvinus, King of Hungary, in Buda Castle between 1458 and 1490. It was destroyed after the Hungarian defeat by the Ottomans in the Battle of Moh√°cs in 1526.
